translation: Marriage is no necessity.
transcript: 结婚不是必需品。

translation: Changjian actually agrees with it.
transcript: 其实昌建兄心里是非常赞同的。

translation: He only regrets that he was born 20 years earlier.
transcript: 只是他觉得他早生了二十年。

translation: Are you married?
transcript: 你结婚了没有啊？

translation: Does your mom urge you to get married?
transcript: 你妈是不是在催你结婚啊？

translation: Will you get married?
transcript: 你未来是不是也要结婚呢？

translation: Have you ever thought about ta question: what's the point of getting married?
transcript: 有没有想过这么一个问题啊，你为什么要结婚呢？

translation: Once, or for most of Chinese history, the question had been a taboo.
transcript: 这个问题，曾经是不可以问的，或者在过去很漫长的中国历史上你是不可以问的。

translation: Why is that?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: Because marriage has been a must for Chinese, westerners aside, over quite a long time.
transcript: 因为在很长的时间里，对中国人来说，我们先不管外国的事情，对中国人来说，结婚真的是必需品，人人必须结婚。

translation: First of all, men need to marry women for reproduction.
transcript: 对男人来说，首先，他要通过女人来繁衍后代。

translation: Here are two pictures I found online.
transcript: 你看这上面两张照片。

translation: One was taken at the end of Qing dynasty, in the middle of which is a  man, who seems to be rich,  sitting with his wife and concubine, one on each side of him.
transcript: 我从网上找的，一张是清朝末年的，当中的这个男坐着，看着是个有钱人，一左一右是老婆和和妾。

translation: In fact, it was quite common for men to marry more than two women at that time.
transcript: 其实两个并不多。

translation: Gu Hongming, the then professor of Peking University with queue as well as a thorough knowledge of both western and traditional Chinese civilizations, had once said that the best marrige involved one husband and four wives.
transcript: 北大的那位留辫子的那个洋教授啊，学贯中西的辜鸿铭，曾经有一句著名的话，他说最好的夫妻模式是：一个男人和四个老婆。

translation: He made an analogy that one teapot is always set with four cups, because they are perfectly together.
transcript: 因为他还比喻过，是一个茶壶要配四个茶杯，那才是最完美的搭配。

translation: This picture was taken in the 1920s when marriage was necessary for both men and women.
transcript: 再旁边这张照片呢，是二十年代的一张结婚照。

translation: At that time, men need marriage for  procreation, not to mention women who were in particular want of marriage.
transcript: 在那个年代，男人是结婚是需要繁衍后代，女人就更不必说了，那个年代女人特别需要结婚。

translation: Just as the saying goes: "Marrying a man is for food and clothing".
transcript: 有那么一句话嘛，嫁汉嫁汉，穿衣吃饭。

translation: Therefore,  you leave your parents and move to another family, your husband.
transcript: 所以，你离开你父母，然后你要投奔另外一个父母，其实就是你的丈夫。

translation: In the eyes of moden people, marriage was the career of every woman at that time.
transcript: 换到今天来说，结婚是那个时代女人的职业呀。

translation: Can you live without working?
transcript: 你能不工作吗？

translation: No.
transcript: 不能。

translation: So, at that point, marriage was women's career, and your husbands were your bosses.
transcript: 所以那个时代，结婚是职业，然后，你的老板，就是你的丈夫。

translation: At that time, a husband might be away from home for years.
transcript: 所以在那个年代，如果这个男人，跟你结了婚，离家很多年。

translation: He might come back home once in a year, or even once in five years or ten years, claiming that he's pursuing his career.
transcript: 呃一年回来一次，十甚至五年十年回来一次，号称在外面奋斗。

translation: At the same time, the wife took care of children and elders at home and counted on the husband to support the family.
transcript: 然后，他只要负责给你家用就可以了，然后女人在家带孩子孝敬老老人。

translation: The husband, however, might have mistresses in different places, or, take one, two or three concubines.
transcript: 然后这个男人，可能在不同的码头有不同的女人，或者随着时光的推延，他会娶二房、三房、四房。

translation: But he would never divorce his first wive.
transcript: 那么大房，他是永远不会把你休掉的。

translation: Don't worry.
transcript: 放心吧。

translation: Although the husband might give the wife the cold shoulder day after day, the wife, as a dominant figure among his women, controlled the purse strings of the family all the time.
transcript: 十年、二十年不跟你再行夫妻之事，你的大婆的位子是非常的坚挺的，而且，那把掌管钱箱的钥匙，一定是在你手里的。

translation: It was the wife who was buried with the husband after death, and for sure, the name of the wife would be carved on the tombstone, showing her honor.
transcript: 当你们死的时候哦，你们会埋在一起的，你会非常荣耀地刻在墓碑上，你是老大。

translation: I don't know whether concubines had the honor.
transcript: 妾们不知道在不在墓碑上，这个时候我没想过这个问题。

translation: Anyhow, getting married was of great significance during that era.
transcript: 反正是，结婚在那个年代，曾经是非常有意义的。

translation: Another picture I found online is a representative of the wedding pictures in 1980s.
transcript: 后来呢，时光到了八十年代，这张结婚照也是我从网上找来的。

translation: The wedding pictures at that time were particularly recognizable.
transcript: 八十年代结婚照很有特点。

translation: The newly married couple were holding a bunch of plastic flowers; the bride was wearing a wedding veil and a fake pearl necklace.
transcript: 新娘子和新郎前面有一束塑料花，然后呢新娘子这脖子里有一个假的珍珠项链，还有一个头纱。

translation: The picture on the left is a still of Talky Zhang Damin's Happy Life, a TV drama produced in 1998.
transcript: 左边这张照片，是我找出来的，1998年拍摄的一部电视剧叫《贫嘴张大民的幸福生活》。

translation: The TV drama is quite interesting, worth watching if you are interested.
transcript: 有兴趣的朋友，可以到网上找来看一下，特别有意思。

translation: It tells the life story about a men named Zhang Damin, an ordinary worker in Beijing, who was born in 1950s and laid-off in his middle age.
transcript: 说的是北京的一个普通工人，他其实是个五零后，后来也下岗了。

translation: It is not uncommon for this generation to have four or five siblings; Zhang Damin was the eldest brother of four brothers and sisters.
transcript: 他们家兄弟姐妹五个，五零后经常家里生四五个，他是老大。

translation: The family squeezed in a tiny courtyard house.
transcript: 他们住在北京一个非常狭窄的四合院里。

translation: Their father who was a worker has passed away for long.
transcript: 父亲是个工人，很早就去世了。

translation: As the eldest brother, one of the primary tasks of Zhang Damin was to to make room in the pocket-size home to get his younger brothers married.
transcript: 就是他是个大哥，他有一件事情非常重要，他就是在家里要摆，很小的房子，但是他还要摆出来让他的弟弟结婚。

translation: He had developed a skill of making the most of space.
transcript: 他很能摆。

translation: The five siblings had used to sleep on bunk beds.
transcript: 他们原来，兄弟姐妹五个都睡那个高低铺。

translation: Thanks to Zhang Damin's skill, one of his brothers got a private space to get married, which was seprated from others by a curtain.
transcript: 他摆来摆去呢，能让其中一个兄弟，拉个帘子就结婚了。

translation: Unfortunately, his eldest sister was unmarried though she was above 30 years old.
transcript: 那么，其中有一个，她的大妹妹呢过了三十还嫁不出去。

translation: She became a transgressor of the family, as she occupied the room for her future sister-in-law.
transcript: 哦，那简直是罪人，因为你必须出去啊，你不出去，你的兄弟没没有床结婚呐，你必须出去。

translation: The youngest brother finally couldn't tolerate the predicament, so he applied for a university which was far away from home.
transcript: 然后，他最小的弟弟，觉得在北京这么生活太憋屈了，就远离家乡，离开北京，去考了外地一个大学。

translation: Before he left, he said to his elder brothers in tears that their home was so small that he wanted to leave.
transcript: 临走的时候，跟他哥哥哭了说，我们家太憋屈了，所以我要去考到外地去。

translation: Zhang Damin built a 6 square meters hut in the courtyard when himself got married.
transcript: 等到张大民自己结婚的时候呢，他们在那个四合院的小院子里，大概搭了一个六平米的小房子。

translation: Despite his effort, he couldn't remove the tree in the hut, so the hut accommodated the couple and the tree which was as tall as the wall.
transcript: 他很会摆，可惜这个房子里面有一棵树，这棵树不能砍掉，所以这棵树一直通到天花板。

translation: In the 6 square meters hut with a tree, Zhang Damin welcomed the birth of his son and named the newborn Xiaoshu which meant small tree.
transcript: 后来他的儿子出生了，就在这六平米的有树的房子里，他给他儿子取名叫小树。

translation: So, the life of Zhang Damin was bittersweet.
transcript: 所以，张大民的幸福生活饱含着眼泪。

translation: Worse still, Zhang Damin got laid-off and only had some vacuum flasks which were the products of the factory as subsidies.
transcript: 后来他还下岗了，没没有钱拿回家，就要买断工龄嘛，结果就是拿了一堆热水瓶回家，那是他们工厂的产品。

translation: At that time, marriage used to hold a very important meaning.
transcript: 在那个年代，结婚还有一件非常非常非常重要的意义，今天已经不复存在。

translation: I remember when I was a kid, it was a custom in Shanghai that bridegrooms should call out a sentence on the street, with a gong sometimes.
transcript: 我记得我小时候，去喝喜酒闹洞房的时候，上海有个风俗，晚上他们要叫新郎在街上喊一句话，有的时候还是给他一打一面锣，让他大声地喊出来。

translation: Would you please call it out with me?
transcript: 帅哥，请帮着喊一嗓子？

translation: "I become a man today! "
transcript: 我今天做人喽！

translation: "I become a man today!"
transcript: 我今天做人了！

translation: Do you post-80s know it?
transcript: 所以八零后你知道吗？

translation: Your father might have done the same on the wedding day if you are from Shanghai.
transcript: 你如果是个上海人，你爸爸当年闹洞房的时候，就喊过这句话。

translation: What does it mean?
transcript: 什么意思呢？

translation: It means the bridegroom could have sex legally from that day on because premarital sex was forbidden.
transcript: 从今天开始，哥们儿可以合法地进行性生活了，因为在结婚前是不可以的。

translation: Men might be convicted of hooliganism because of premarital sex.
transcript: 如果在那个年代，结婚前你有性关系，那可能被判流氓罪，对吗。

translation: And premarital sex would be a reproach to girls.
transcript: 姑娘就更不用说了，那那简直是名节不保。

translation: Thus, people used to attach a great importance to marriage.
transcript: 所以，以前结婚有这么大的意义。

translation: After all, you can enjoy basic human rights only after marriage, right?
transcript: 我称它为结婚了你才能有基本的人权呢，对不对呀？

translation: Where is the applause?
transcript: 此处可以有掌声了？

translation: Marriage was the licence to the basic rights of citizens.
transcript: 你不结婚，你得不到一个公民可以享有的最最基本的权利，没有。

translation: It was the story mere 30 years ago.
transcript: 所以，虽然好像才是30年以前的事情。

translation: Nevertheless, China had witnessed so many changes over the past 30 years.
transcript: 但是，这30年中国变化实在是太快了。

translation: Although I said the view that marriage is unnecessary came from the future.
transcript: 你知道，虽然我刚刚说我是从未来带给大家一个消息，结婚不是必需品。

translation: The opinion actually germinated seven or eight years ago, on which day exactly?
transcript: 可是其实结婚不是必需品的这个未来，早从大概七八年前就开始了。从哪天开始的？

translation: On the very day when the words "leftover ladies" appeared in media.
transcript: 哪天你在媒体上看到了剩女这两个字，其实结婚就已经不是必需品了。

translation: Having been a psychological counselor for 11 years, I would like to consider myself an expert on leftover ladies.
transcript: 我自己是一个心理咨询师，这个工作做了十一年，我大概是中国可以称为剩女专家了。

translation: Over the 11 years, I probably have heard 1,000-2,000 stories about the marriage and relationship of the Chinese.
transcript: 春江水暖鸭先知，因为我在这个前沿工作，过去11年，我大概我没算过，我大概看了一两千个中国人的婚姻和恋爱了吧。

translation: The words "leftover ladies" have caught my eye the moment I saw them, so I looked close into the group.
transcript: 那么当剩女词汇出现的时候，我就特别关注这个人群。

translation: I realised that my clients are not only the couples who are going through a divorce but also the so-called leftover ladies.
transcript: 后来我发现，愿意花钱来找我咨询的，不再仅仅是那些要闹离婚的人，而是这些被媒体称为剩女的人。

translation: The ladies are well-educated; some have studied abroad.
transcript: 她们都有非常好的本科以上的教育背景，而且有些也是海归。

translation: They have decent jobs, fat salaries and gorgeous appearance.
transcript: 工作也很不错，收入也很不错，相貌也很不错。

translation: They came for one question: why should I get married?
transcript: 她们就是来跟我只谈一个问题，吴老师，我为什么要结婚呢？

translation: I don't like anyone in perticular.
transcript: 我没有特别喜爱的人。

translation: I don't love anyone in perticular.
transcript: 我没有特别爱的人。

translation: I don't think that my life is imcomplete and that I need a husband.
transcript: 我是不觉得我生活中有缺憾，我需一定需要个丈夫。

translation: But everyone, especially my parents and grandparents, tell me it is unacceptable to be unmarried."
transcript: 可是我的妈妈、我的外婆、我的爷爷，好像我身边所有的人都告诉我，你必须要结婚，你不结婚那是不可以的。

translation: She went to ask her mom, who was born in the 1950s, why she should get married.
transcript: 她告诉我，当她去问她50后的妈妈问，我为什么要结婚呢。

translation: Her mon said: "Cut the crap. It is a meaningless question. Everyone will get married. Every normal person will get married. Marriage is never for happiness and love; marriage is for living. I married your father without love and gave birth to you, don't you live a happy life?"
transcript: 她妈妈告诉说，少废话，不要问那么多，问那么多干什么，人都是要结婚的，正常人都是要结婚的；谁说结婚是为了幸福和恩爱的，根本没这回事儿，结婚就是为了凑合过日子，我跟你爸就是这样子，然后还把你生出来了，你不是活得挺好的吗？

translation: The parents of leftover ladies were born in 1950s and married at the end of 1970s and the beginning of 1980s.
transcript: 对啊，你父母是五零后，所以呢他们在结婚的时候，差不多是七十年代末八十年代初。

translation: It was a luxury if they married for love and happiness in those days.
transcript: 在他们那个年代，结婚确实没有奢侈到为了爱情，为了幸福。

translation: I had TV shows and radio shows before.
transcript: 啊我经常以前在呃电视台、电台做节目。

translation: When I was working at the Eastern People's Broadcasting Station, I answered the calls from the audiences of a programme called "Harmonious Home".
transcript: 然后，我曾经有一段时间在东方人民广播电台的一个叫“和谐一家门”的节目里面接听众电话。

translation: The programmed was on from 12:00 to 13:00, so most of the calls were made by the senior in their 60s.
transcript: 那是个十二点到一点的节目，所以你可想而知，那个时候打电话进来的都是老人家，大部分是六十几岁的。

translation: In most cases, they were worried about their unmarried children.
transcript: 我常常接到这样的电话，就是他们很着急他们的子女结不了婚。

translation: They would start the conversation by saying "Ms Wu, my daughter is very outstanding."
transcript: 啊开口就是吴老师我跟你说，我女儿很优秀的。

translation: After plenty of similar calls, I would interrupt them by saying "ah, she is leftover, isn't she?"
transcript: 时间长了我就知道了，我说哦知道了，嫁不出去对吧？

translation: In the end, they wouldn't dare to make such calls any more.
transcript: 后来他们再也不敢说我女儿很优秀这件事情。

translation: My behaviour got the broadcasting station in trouble, as the seniors often complained against me to the publicity department.
transcript: 因为我在那讲这些话，然后呢给电台招来了很大的麻烦，因为这些老人家经常写信到宣传部去投诉我。

translation: They said I was misleading the young and propagating heresy.
transcript: 说我要把中国的年轻人带往何处去啊，说我这个放毒啊等等。

translation: From their wording, I inferred that they lived through the Cultural Revolution.
transcript: 用的都是文革的语言，我相信都是经历过文革的人。

translation: I troubled the editors of the broadcasting station a lot.
transcript: 所以我给编辑们，给电台的编辑嗯也惹了不少麻烦。

translation: Your parents, or the people of that generation, may know nothing about love and happiness, but you do.
transcript: 呃，你的父母，那个年代的人，也许不知道爱和幸福和爱情为何物，但是你知道。

translation: Whether you have experienced them or not, or maybe you see them only in films and TV dramas, you have the right to ask the question today that why I get married.
transcript: 也许你经历过，也许你没有经历过，也许你只在电影电视里见过，但是今天，你有权利来问这个问题，就是我为什么要结婚？

translation: You have received the higher education, you earn over RMB 10,000 per month, you have studied abroad, or you have travelled in ten countries, and you are here, at TnDao, you have the right to search for the answer.
transcript: 因为你，已经享有很好的大学教育，你居然一个月也挣一两万，你还是海归，你也去过号称十个国家旅游了，你还来听了听道，今天，你有权利问我为什么要结婚。

translation: What is the significance of marriage?
transcript: 今天结婚的理由在哪里呢？

translation: If we examine the reasons for women to get married in the 1920s, the 1980s and today, we can see that women back then had no jobs., which is totally different from today.
transcript: 看看前面两张，二十年代和八十年代结婚的理由，你今天很难找到同样的理由了，你有职业了。

translation: And at that time, couples were required to be well-matched in social and economic status.
transcript: 然后按照门当户对的原则。

translation: They shouldn't be expecting to move up the social ladder through marriage.
transcript: 结婚不能帮你跳跃社会阶层，因为你必须要找个门当户对的。

translation: If you're a middle class, you should marry a middle class.
transcript: 如果你的门在中产阶级，那你找到也是中产阶级。

translation: If you're a working class, you should marry a working class.
transcript: 如果你是中下的，恐怕最安全的对象也是中下的。

translation: Yuanyuan laid emphasis on money; frankly speaking, I don't despise material women.
transcript: 说实话，刚刚媛媛谈了很多钱钱钱的问题，我还真不鄙视物质女。

translation: They have a clear goal of marriage which is to obtain better economic status.
transcript: 我觉得，她们要结婚的目标，目的非常情晰，只有一个，我要钱。

translation: It is a simple expectation.
transcript: 挺好，要钱，目标很单纯。

translation: Women who want only money from marriage and improve thei financial status will not be leftover, because their purpose of getting married falls on one thing, money.
transcript: 然后希希望通过婚姻，改变你的经济状况，如果你的目的那么单纯，说实话，你不会成为剩女的。

translation: The possibly leftover ladies are the girls who want everything from marriage.
transcript: 成为剩女的可能性，只是因为我什么都想要。

translation: People have accpeted idea that marriage is not a must.
transcript: 结婚不是必需品，它已经在发生了。

translation: The figures given by the Shanghai Civil Affairs Bureau in 2014 showed that men in Shanghai got married for the first time at the age 30.11, women at the age of 28.14.
transcript: 看看这组数字吧，2014年，这不是我编的数字啊，上海民政局的数字，你看看那个初婚年龄，男的30.11，女的28.14，这是上海的平均年龄。

translation: As a student of liberal arts, I am not good at mathematics, but the figures shocked me that people in Shanghai waited so long to get married, don't you think so?
transcript: 我是一个文科生，数学不太好，但是我看到这个数字的时候，我不知道你怎么想的，我有一个反应，我想，啊，上海人结婚这么晚啊，是不是啊？

translation: The average age of first marriage is 30 years old.
transcript: 平均三十岁，说明什么。

translation: Showing that many, the female included, are not married until over 30 years old.
transcript: 说明有很多的人是过了三十多岁才结婚的，女性也是啊。

translation: I am curious about the Chinese's future view on marriage.
transcript: 然后我很想知道，中国以后的走向会怎么样，结婚的走向。

translation: Are you curious as well?
transcript: 你们也想知道？

translation: It is easy to predict it by having a look at the developed countries.
transcript: 其实并不难，你看看欧美发达国家是什么样你就知道了。

translation: A friend of mine married a Finnish, so I asked her for help.
transcript: 我有一个女朋友嫁到了芬兰，嫁给了芬兰人，我拜托她帮我查一下芬兰的数字。

translation: She found the figures below.
transcript: 大家看嘛。

translation: In 2014, the Finnish authority published the average age of first marriage was 30 years old for women in Finland, which was similar to the figures for Shanghai.
transcript: 2014年芬兰，类似于民政局这样的机构公布的数字，女性结婚的普普初婚年龄跟我们上海差不了多少，三十岁。

translation: After ten year's marriage, it comes the time of divorce, so the average age of first divorce is 39 years old.
transcript: 诶，你看婚姻，结了十年婚该离了，所以第一次离婚的年龄是39。

translation: Over the past 20 years, the divorce rate in Finland has been stable at 55%, but the marriage rate has been dropping.
transcript: 然后我过去二十年芬兰的离婚率一直55%，然后过去多少年，结婚率下降很多。

translation: It would be the future of Shanghai in 10, 20 or 30 years.
transcript: 这就是十年、二十年、三十年以后，至少是上海的状况，就是这个样子。

translation: Over half of couples would get divorced, and half of children would come from single-parent families.
transcript: 就是超过一半的人会离婚，有一半的孩子，将来自于离婚家庭、非婚生的子女。

translation: In the countries like Finland, the famale are independent with respect to economy and spirit, and legitimate and illegitimate children have the same civic rights.
transcript: 因为在类似于芬兰这样的国家，女性在经济上、精神上都是非常独立的，而且它的法律对婚结婚的，婚生和非婚生的子女，享有的公民权利也是一致的。

translation: For the young Chinese today, marriage is just a licence to raise children.
transcript: 那么今天，对今天的年轻人来讲，结婚是好像只有生孩子这一件事是必须结婚的，其他都不用。

translation: It is common to have online romance via apps like Momo, so it is fine to be single.
transcript: 咱都有陌陌了对吧，所以家里没个女人没关系，家里没个男人也没关系。

translation: People need love and sex.
transcript: 那么唯一需要的，恐怕就是爱情，爱情和性。

translation: But love, sex and marriage are not the same thing.
transcript: 那爱情和性，其实跟婚姻不是一样的东西。

translation: They are independent from one another, but interdependent at times.
transcript: 它们是三样东西，各自独立，有的时候会混在一起，有的时候分开。

translation: In most cases, they are independent from one another.
transcript: 在大部分情况下，是分开的。

translation: It is not my thoughts but the facts I have been noticed, summarised and recorded.
transcript: 这不是我的观点，这只是我的观察、总结和记录，我只是告诉你一些事实。

translation: It is intriguing that in August, 2011, The Economist, a serious English-language magazine focusing on economics, published a cover story, Asia's Lonely Hearts – Why Asian Women Are Rejecting Marriage and What That Means.
transcript: 这件事儿很有意思，2011年8月，《经济学人》杂志，这是非常严肃的一本呃经济类的杂志，英文的，登了这么一篇封面文章，简单地说，翻成中文叫亚洲女性不想结婚。

translation: You can browse it online if interested.
transcript: 有兴趣的朋友到网上去查一下。

translation: I found a very detailed Chinese translation of the article via Baidu yesterday.
transcript: 我昨天还百度过，还在，有中文翻译，非常详尽。

translation: The writer did a survey and found out that the proportion of the unmarried professional women in their 30s and 40s who received higher education reached 25-35% in the developed Asian countries and regions.
transcript: 他们做了一份调查，他们发现，在亚洲发达地区和国家，过了三十岁，甚至过了四十岁，还不结婚的，受过高等教育的职业女性，这个不婚的比例25%到35%之多。

translation: It is interesting that the writer said similar phenomena were not found in China and India, the two largest developing countries in Asia.
transcript: 然后这篇文章特别有意思，它还说亚洲最大的两个国家印度和中国，没有，还没有受到什么影响。

translation: If you ask me, that’s absolute nonsense.
transcript: 我想这作者简直是瞎了眼了可是。

translation: I started my Relationship Camp in March 2011 and realised that similar phenomena had shot up in China, at least in the higher-tier cities.
transcript: 我的恋爱训练营，2011年3月就办了，中国这个状况至少在发几个发达城市，这个状况是很很严重的。

translation: My conservative estimate on the percentage of single well-educated women in their 30s is 25% in Shanghai.
transcript: 应该说过了三十岁的单身女性，受过高等教育的，在上海25%单身，这太正常了吧。

translation: My Relationship Camp attracted the attention of media at home and abroad, particularly the foreign media.
transcript: 然后我的恋爱训练营办了以后，受到过很多媒体的采访，特别是国外媒体，很有意思。

translation: AFP, CBS, ABC and others interviewed me.
transcript: 法新社、CBS、什么ABC都来了。

translation: They believed that the increase in the number of women reluctant to get married reflected the progress of China's 30-year Reform and Opening Up and was an inevitable result of China's ballooning GDP.
transcript: 他们都认为，这个女人不想结婚这件事，是中国改革开放三十年的进程的一个缩影，是中国GDP高走的必然结果。

translation: I remember we learned in middle schools that production relations are determined by productive forces, am I right?
transcript: 我们中学时候都中学课本学会一句话，我其他全忘了，有一句话我记得，叫生产力决定生产关系，对不对？

translation: The marital relation is a kind of production relations.
transcript: 婚姻关系就是生产关系中的一环嘛。

translation: When they had no access to education and jobs, women had to get married.
transcript: 所以在女人不能够求学，不能够工作的年代，当然必必须结婚。

translation: But the necessity has disappeared.
transcript: 但今天这个必然就会不存在了。

translation: The picture was taken in 1931.
transcript: 这张照片拍摄于1931年。

translation: The girl with short hair and wearing western suits is my grandma.
transcript: 当中这个站着的短发洋装女子，是我的奶奶。

translation: The photo records a group of freinds.
transcript: 这是一群闺蜜照。

translation: Females like them in those days were trendy.
transcript: 在那个年代这样的女性，是领风气之先的。

translation: They were the first patch of Chinese female university students.
transcript: 她们是中国最早的一批大学生，女大学生。

translation: My grandma majored in laws.
transcript: 我祖母还是学法律的。

translation: After graduation, they went abroad for further study.
transcript: 然后她们又去留洋了。

translation: It was unprecedented for women to have short hair, wear western clothes and attend schools, not to mention to work and to sit as equals at the same table with men.
transcript: 在那个年代，女人敢剪短发、穿洋装、出来受教育，这个就是非常了不得的事情，还跟男人平起平坐，想要工作。

translation: I am afraid it was as stressful for them as the current unmarried females in their 30s.
transcript: 那么换到今天，恐怕就是三十岁还不结婚的单身女性面临的压力。

translation: What worries women changes with time.
transcript: 所以时代在变迁，只是女性碰到的问题，碰到的难题不一样而已。

translation: Modern females have more choices.
transcript: 今天的女性有更多的选择。

translation: The photo was taken in 2015, exactly yesterday.
transcript: 刚刚是1931年的闺蜜照，这是2015年，昨天拍的闺蜜照。

translation: You can find me wearing the same suit in the photo.
transcript: 其中有我，就是穿鞋这身衣服的。

translation: I am a member of the club called the Club of Thirteen Women; the head is Jian Fang.
transcript: 呃，我在上海参加了一个黑暗组织，头目是简昉，呃叫十三姨俱乐部。

translation: There are only 11 members in the photo; a post-85s photographer took it for us.
transcript: 这上面人还没齐，只有十一个人，前面一个是年轻的85后摄影师。

translation: We wanted to take a picture before we are too old, so we went to a photographic studio yesterday.
transcript: 我们昨天拍的闺蜜照，去专业影棚拍的，趁着我们还不太老，去拍一张闺蜜照。

translation: All the women in the photo were in their 40s.
transcript: 这照片上的女人都是四十多岁的，年龄在四十到五十之间。

translation: Seven of them gave speeches at TnDao.
transcript: 这十一个人当中，其中有七个人曾经是在这个地方做过演讲。

translation: You can find well-known hostesses, the partners of the Big Four, female entrepreneurs, soprano artists and me here.
transcript: 她们当中有著名的电台的主持人，电视台的主持人，呃有四大会计所的合伙人，有女创业家，有女高音歌唱家，啊当然还有我。

translation: Some of them are single; some married three times; some are DINKs; some are single mothers.
transcript: 这是十一个人，四十多岁，有至今单身的，有结了三次婚的，有结了婚不生孩子的，可是也有不结婚就生孩子的，还做了单亲妈妈。

translation: Therefore, modern women are much more fortunate than the women in 1931.
transcript: 所以今天的女人比1931年的女人幸福得多。

translation: Modern women can decide to get married or not on their own will.
transcript: 今天的女人，你可以决定，你要不要结婚。

translation: You have the right to get your answer and you will not be forced to get married by the tears of families.
transcript: 你有权利问，你不再会为妈妈的眼泪、外婆的眼泪、外公的眼泪而结婚。

translation: Women shall decide their own marriage.
transcript: 你的婚姻，是你自己主宰的东西。

translation: In the end, I would like to quote a line from a play: a city without gays and leftover ladies can't be an international metropolis!
transcript: 最后一句话，想借用一个小话剧的一句有趣的台词，献给大家：一个城市，如果没有gay和剩女，它就不能被称为是个国际大都市！

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢大家。
